Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2008 11:28PM Robin585 wrote: Hi Barbara, Like you, I am new to this process.  So far my experience has been good. The surgeon I met with was great.  However, she will not be doing the biopsy.  The radiologist will.  So, is the surgeon you met with actually going to do the biopsy and/or the MRI?  If not, then consider keeping the appointment so you can get the information you need for the next step. The other people you deal with at the facility may have a different approach.  Different people, different day - who knows what will happen.  It could be good.  I think that it is important to feel like you have some control over an out of control situation.  So whatever decision you make, it isn't wrong. It just changes the timing of things.  All that I have read on these blogs indicates that everyone here is so very supportive and knowledgable. You'll find no critcism here.  Do what you want and need to do for yourself without worrying too much what it means to others. While it is good to have passengers along as you go down this road, you are still the driver.  Robin
Posts.Title: Not sure where to go now BarbaraS HeatherBLocklear
